de.uni.leipzig.asv.zitationsgraph.preprocessing

Class FolderReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni.leipzig.asv.zitationsgraph.preprocessing.FolderReader

  • public class FolderReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to read all files of a folder and preprocess them, aka create BaseDocs. Holds also method to dump the splitted parts into text files and a method to recreate BaseDocs out of dumped files.
    Author:
    Klaus Lyko

      • saveSplitsToTextFiles

        public void saveSplitsToTextFiles(BaseDoc[] docs)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Method to dump processed files into text files. A single BaseDoc is dumped into 3 text files, named SOURCENAME_PART.text, whereupon PART is either BaseDoc.HEAD, BaseDoc.BODY or BaseDoc.REFERENCES.
        Parameters:
        docs - Array of BaseDocs to be dumped to the output folder.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadDumpedParts

        public java.util.List<BaseDoc> loadDumpedParts(java.lang.String folder)
        Try to recreate BaseDoc out of dumped text files in a folder.
        Parameters:
        folder - where the dumped files a saved.
        Returns:
        A List of created BaseDocs.
